CatDescriptText: Henry Wheeler, laborer, Hill District and Ralph V. Miller, salesman for a wine company, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "In what areas of endeavor or public accommodations do you find the most discrimination?"  Mr. Wheeler's answer reads: "Housing and jobs.  In South Side, baking companies discriminate."  Mr. Miller's answer reads: "Since I am a salesman, I don't find things as though as other people."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Henry Wheeler wearing heart and spade patterned shirt, eyeglasses, and hat with wide band, standing in front of building; Portrait of Ralph V. Miller wearing rectangular patterned necktie and hat with wide band, standing in front of building
